definition: (used at the end of a letter to introduce a polite salutation)
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey
respectfully yours (at the end of a letter)

sentences.english: Sincerely hope you might offer us the chance to serve for you.
sentences.chinese: 此致希望您可以提供我们有机会为您服务。

sentences.english: Enjoy the beauty of this silver-plated and crystal Expressively Yours bracelet.
sentences.chinese: 享受这美丽的镀银和晶体意味深长此致手镯。

sentences.english: These or those ? the red ones , please.
sentences.chinese: 这些还是那此致？请来这些红的。

sentences.english: Was he fired or did he quit?
sentences.chinese: 他是自己此致还是被解雇的？

definition: respectfully yours (at the end of a letter)
to offer humbly (written at the end of letter from sb of lower status to higher status)/your humble servant
yours truly/yours sincerely (at the end of a letter)
to respectfully inform (used at the beginning or end of letters)
to express/to present/to extend/to tender (greetings, thanks etc)
to wish/to express good wishes/to pray/(old) wizard
to have all one's wishes (idiom)/best wishes/all the best/may all your hopes be fulfilled
